text: Vining is a city in Clay and Washington counties in Kansas, United States. In 2020, 43 people lived there. ==History== Vining was first called West Clifton. It was planned out as West Clifton in 1877. It was renamed Vining in 1881, in honor of E. P. Vining, a railroad worker. Vining was once an important shipping point. This was because it was on the Republican River and at the junction of two railroads. The post office in Vining closed in 1955. ==Geography== Vining is at (39.567319, -97.293613). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. The city is located next to Clifton. ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 43 people living in Vining. There were 9 households. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 45 people, 24 households, and 13 families living in Vining. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * Vining - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * Clifton-Clyde USD 224, local school district ;Maps * Vining City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Washington County, Kansas Category:1877 establishments in Kansas Category:Cities in Clay County, Kansas
title: Vining, Kansas
